column5: Just wondering if anyone has ever used or tried sardines or herring for pike??  Does it work???
Use them all the time on a quick strike rig, the bigger the sardine the better in my experience.  I hang them a foot or so off the bottom, head down.  Burt
I'm looking for large frozen Sardines or Herring for my spring trip to Canada --- any idea where I can order them and have them shipped to me?

You could get one of the Canadian sellers to ship to your fishing location/lodger/outfitter etc. or have a US dealer ship to you as it sounds like you're South of the border.  Canadian (East Coast) herring seller: http://www.a1seafood.com/html/herring_wholesale_herring_bait.html  Canadian (West Coast) herring seller: http://www.bluewaterbait.ca/sports/herring/  US online bait seller:  http://www.fishonbait.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=category&layout=blog&id=37&Itemid=123

I've used them with a quick strike rig as mentioned. I have also let them lay on the bottom. Seems to target larger pike either way.  I've only used them ice fishing on a tip up.  Not sure how well they would work in open water.  Why not just pick some up at the local grcery store like I do?  If you ask your outfitter, I'm sure they could make sure they were on hand when you get there.
